SEARCH
Package gameplay

Class TichuGame

java.lang.Object
gameplay.TichuGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TichuGame extends Object implements Serializable
The TichuGame class represents the core logic for managing a game of Tichu. It keeps track of the game state, player actions, and scoring. The class includes methods for handling Tichu declarations, managing rounds, updating player and team statistics, and persisting game data. The game follows the rules of the Tichu card game and allows for multiple rounds with scoring based on individual and team performances.

This class implements the Serializable interface to support serialization for saving and loading game instances.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tömöri Péter
See Also:

      Parameters:
      idx - The index of the player.

      public void greatTichuRound(boolean[] saidGrandTichu)

      public void sortHands()

    • exchangeCards

      public void exchangeCards(int[] cardIdxs)
      Exchanges cards between players based on selected indices. Saving exchanges
      Parameters:
      cardIdxs - An array of indices indicating the cards to exchange. first 3 card is what P1 choose to give to P2, P3 invalid input: '&' P4 4th, 5th invalid input: '&' 6th card was P2's and gave to P3, P4 invalid input: '&' P1 etc.

    • setStartingPlayer

      public void setStartingPlayer()
      Sets the starting player for the first round of the game. Always the player with the Sparrow starts the first round

    • getNextPlayer

      public int getNextPlayer()
      Finds out which player has to start the game and returns the index of the player.
      Returns:
      The index of the player who starts the game.

      public void initRound()
      Initializes the data for a new round, resetting round-specific variables.

    • viewDataInt

      public int[] viewDataInt()
      Prepares data for the controller to forward to the display. 0: actual players canSayTichu value 1-3: other players' number of cards in hand 4-6: other players saidTichu values 7-9: other players' placement 10-12: roundCombo data (passes, value, wish)
      Returns:
      An array of integers representing various game data for display.

    • viewDataString

      public String[] viewDataString()
      Prepares data for the controller to forward to the display. 0-2: other Players' name 3-4: roundCombo data: type and winner player
      Returns:
      An array of strings representing various game data for display.

    • setViewToPrevPlayer

      public void setViewToPrevPlayer(int[] modint, String[] modstr)
      Modifies the view to display the previous player's data without changing the game state.
      Parameters:
      modint - An array of integers to modify based on the previous player's data.
      modstr - An array of strings to modify based on the previous player's data.

    • saidTichu

      public void saidTichu()
      Attempts to play a combination based on the provided card indexes.
      Parameters:
      cardIndexes - An array of boolean values indicating the selected cards for the combo.

    • playCombination

      public boolean playCombination(boolean[] cardIndexes)
      Attempts to play a combination based on the provided card indexes. If they pushed the OK button, we check what they want to play If its correct the move is made, if its not, then warning and replay
      Parameters:
      cardIndexes - An array of boolean values indicating the selected cards for the combo.
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid and executed successfully, false otherwise.

    • wonWithDragon

      public boolean wonWithDragon()
      Checks if the winner of the round won with a Dragon card.
      Returns:
      true if the winner won with a Dragon card, false otherwise.

    • isSparrowPlayed

      public boolean isSparrowPlayed()
      Checks if Sparrow card was played in the last round.
      Returns:
      true if Sparrow was played, false otherwise.

    • roundOver

      public void roundOver(int comboGetIdx)
      Handles the end of a round, distributing cards to the winner and setting up the next round (starting player)
      Parameters:
      comboGetIdx - The index of the player who gets the cards.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles the end of the game, calculates points, and updates statistics.

    • putLastCards

      public void putLastCards(ArrayList<Player> players)
      Transfers the last player's hand to the proper players. Updates the player's and opponent's table cards. Last player's hand will be the opponents. First player will get the lasts taken combinations.
      Parameters:
      players - The list of players.
